questions.question: Which of the following is an example of supervised learning?
What is overfitting in machine learning?

options.A: When the model performs well on training data but poorly on test data
options.B: When the model performs well on both training and test data
options.C: When the model performs poorly on both training and test data
options.D: When the model performs poorly on training data but well on test data

What is the vanishing gradient problem?

options.A: When gradients become too large and lead to exploding gradients
options.B: When the gradients of the loss function become too small for effective learning
options.C: When the model cannot find the global minimum
options.D: When the model overfits on training data

questions.question: Which of the following is a dimensionality reduction technique?
What is the curse of dimensionality?

options.A: The difficulty in training models with high-dimensional data
options.B: The difficulty in training models with low-dimensional data
options.D: The difficulty in defining loss functions

questions.question: What is the main difference between bagging and boosting?

options.A: Bagging is sequential while boosting is parallel
options.B: Bagging reduces variance while boosting reduces bias
options.C: Boosting uses weak learners and bagging uses strong learners
options.D: Bagging increases bias and boosting reduces variance

questions.question: What does a ReLU activation function do?

options.A: Transforms negative values into zero and leaves positive values unchanged
options.B: Transforms positive values into zero and leaves negative values unchanged
options.C: Applies a non-linear transformation to all input values
options.D: Outputs the logarithm of the input
